channel.title: Posts on hurtling through space
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on hurtling through space

item.title: The Voices in my Head over an Internet Protocol - VHoIP #1
item.author: hello@saisneha.com (Sneha S)
item.description: I wanted to have a way to just jot down the various voices running through my head - perhaps it would be of some use to whoever else stumbles upon this. Sunday - Wednesday (14 -17 July 2024) - Quick, non-detailed Recap Met friends on Sunday, spent time with partner in the morning. Slow day. Good day. Monday - Wednesday was spent working on a few things at work - a bit of firefighting and a bit of prioritising for the coming days.

item.title: Migrating my Mail and Cloud (De-Faanging my Life Ep #2)
item.author: hello@saisneha.com (Sneha S)
item.description: So, as I explained two weeks back, I’m making a concerted effort to move away from the big tech giants - opting for smaller, privacy centric options. This week, I’m going to document my journey there in a few key areas - Mail, Calendar, Meetings, and Cloud storage. I will be rambling quite a bit. Before I get started, a colleague shared a very interesting article about the energy all our data consumes, comparing making an instagram post or tweet to switching on a light bulb that will never switch off.

item.title: De-FAANGing and De-googling my Life Ep #1: Framework and Dragons
item.author: hello@saisneha.com (Sneha S)
item.description: Over the last few years, I’ve experimented with various online services, free and paid, and explored their feature sets, advantages, and disadvantages. In recent months, I have come to the difficult conclusion that my set up, honed over the past many years, is not only sub-optimal, but is also waiting to break. I’ve also realised that there is a great deal of dependency on Google, Apple, Microsoft, and other similar large tech companies, a group of corporations that used to, very aptly, be referred to as FAANG. I now wish to remedy this.
